title: Lionel Messi tried to stop Ousmane Dembele getting sent off for dissent by CRITICISING his Spanish
text:
Lionel Messi tried to stop team-mate Ousmane Dembele getting sent off against Sevilla by insisting to the referee that the young winger cannot speak Spanish.

Dembele was shown a second yellow card in the closing stages of Barcelona's 4-0 win over Sevilla with the Frenchman reported to have been critical of referee Antonio Mateu.

The referee's report detailed how Dembele frequently used 'Muy malo', translating as 'very bad', but Messi argued the case by criticising his team-mate's language skills in a bid to keep him on the pitch.

Lionel Messi criticised Ousmane Dembele's Spanish skills in a bid to stop him being sent off

The winger was shown a second yellow for dissent as the referee claimed an insult was made

Here's the clip of Messi telling Mateu Lahoz that Dembele "can't speak" Spanish 💀 pic.twitter.com/1lfayANE4D — seyi (@xOluwaseyi) October 7, 2019

Dembele had scored but his evening was overshadowed with his late dismissal, which could now see him suspended for El Clasico against Real Madrid on October 26.

The 22-year-old had picked up a booking early in the second half before his comments in the closing stages saw the referee take action.

But Messi, in comments reported by Marca, went to speak to the referee and tried to suggest Dembele's language skills meant he was not sure what he was saying.

In a video that emerged on social media, Messi said: 'He can't speak [Spanish]!'

His efforts ultimately proved in vain as Dembele, who has been in Spain for two years following his move from Borussia Dortmund, was sent off for a second booking.
